# In R:
install.packages("remotes")               # if you donâ€™t already have it
remotes::install_github("coatless-rpkg/ucimlrepo")
library(ucimlrepo)
# View the first few rows
head(iris)
# View the structure of the dataset
str(iris)
# Summary statistics
summary(iris)
# Quantitative variables: Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, Petal.Length, Petal.Width
quantitative_vars <- iris[, 1:4]
# Summary statistics
summary(quantitative_vars)
# Additional statistics
mean_values <- colMeans(quantitative_vars)
sd_values <- apply(quantitative_vars, 2, sd)
median_values <- apply(quantitative_vars, 2, median)
range_values <- apply(quantitative_vars, 2, range)
# Combine into a data frame
quantitative_stats <- data.frame(
  Mean = mean_values,
  SD = sd_values,
  Median = median_values,
  Min = range_values[1,],
  Max = range_values[2,]
)
print(quantitative_stats)
# Categorical variable: Species
categorical_var <- iris$Species
# Frequency table
species_table <- table(categorical_var)
# Relative frequencies
species_rel_freq <- prop.table(species_table)
# Combine into a data frame
categorical_stats <- data.frame(
  Frequency = species_table,
  Relative_Frequency = species_rel_freq
)
str(iris)
iris$Petal.Length <- as.numeric(iris$Petal.Length)
# Check for missing values
sum(is.na(iris$Petal.Length))


# Apply log transformation to Sepal.Width
iris$Log_Sepal_Width <- log(iris$Sepal.Width + 1)  # Adding 1 to avoid log(0)

data(iris)
iris_clean <- na.omit(iris)
iris$Log_Petal_Length <- log(iris$Petal.Length + 1)  # Adding 1 to avoid log(0)
# Load ggplot2 for plotting
library(ggplot2)

# Plot histograms
par(mfrow = c(1, 2)) # Set up the plotting area

# Original Petal.Length
hist(iris$Petal.Length, main = "Original Petal Length", xlab = "Petal Length", col = "lightblue", border = "black")

# Transformed Log_Petal_Length
hist(iris$Log_Petal_Length, main = "Log Transformed Petal Length", xlab = "Log(Petal Length)", col = "lightgreen", border = "black")

# Load necessary library
library(ggplot2)
# Create histogram for Sepal.Length
ggplot(iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.2, fill = "skyblue", color = "black", alpha = 0.7) +
  labs(title = "Distribution of Sepal Length", x = "Sepal Length (cm)", y = "Frequency") +
  theme_minimal()
  
  # Create scatterplot for Petal.Length vs Petal.Width
ggplot(iris, aes(x = Petal.Length, y = Petal.Width, color = Species)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.7) +
  labs(title = "Petal Length vs Petal Width", x = "Petal Length (cm)", y = "Petal Width (cm)") +
  theme_minimal()
